pnp:Provisioning.Author: John White
pnp:Provisioning.Description: Example site to manage brand assets

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Did you know there are students at Pineview that are in need of a mentor?

Join a student in need of some one-on-one time for lunch, games, crafts and conversation. If you or someone you know is interested, please contact us today.

pnp:CanvasControl.JsonControlData: {"id": "7f718435-ee4d-431c-bdbf-9c4ff326f46e", "instanceId": "5bd1418b-c36b-4fbc-8f2e-5bff50679253", "title": "People", "description": "Display selected people and their profiles", "dataVersion": "1.3", "properties": {"layout":1,"persons":[{"id":"PattiF@M365EDU245790.OnMicrosoft.com","role":"Principal"},{"id":"GradyA@M365EDU245790.OnMicrosoft.com","role":"Teacher"}],"title":""}, "serverProcessedContent": {"htmlStrings":{},"searchablePlainTexts":{"persons[0].name":"Patti Fernandez","persons[1].name":"Grady Archie","persons[0].email":"PattiF@M365EDU245790.OnMicrosoft.com","persons[1].email":"GradyA@M365EDU245790.OnMicrosoft.com"},"imageSources":{},"links":{}}, "dynamicDataPaths": {}, "dynamicDataValues": {}}

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
This year’s extracurricular activities are better than ever,
​​​and students can register now.

No experience is necessary for any of the activities. Students will learn about their chosen discipline, and then have a chance to practice what they’ve learned through performance and hands-on activities.

pnp:CanvasControl.JsonControlData: {"id": "df8e44e7-edd5-46d5-90da-aca1539313b8", "instanceId": "fc8b0110-41bd-4116-a6f5-f63b6920a7cf", "title": "Call to action", "description": "Create a call to action banner with a clickable button", "dataVersion": "1.0", "properties": {"image":{"itemInfo":{"listId":"{listid:Site Assets}","uniqueId":"{fileuniqueid:SiteAssets/SitePages/Registration-for-extracurricular-activities-open/Illuminated-fairy-lights.jpg}","webId":"{siteid}","siteId":"{sitecollectionid}"},"zoomRatio":1},"button":{},"overlayText":{},"alignment":"Left"}, "serverProcessedContent": {"htmlStrings":{},"searchablePlainTexts":{"button.label":"Sign up","overlayText.text":"Do something you love!"},"imageSources":{"image.url":"{site}/SiteAssets/SitePages/Registration-for-extracurricular-activities-open/Illuminated-fairy-lights.jpg"},"links":{}}, "dynamicDataPaths": {}, "dynamicDataValues": {}}

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
Band

Playing in a band helps students with focus, discipline, and self-esteem. Studies have shown that students who play an instrument score higher on math and reading tests. Students will learn how to play their chosen instruments and learn how to play in a group. Students will perform at pep rallies and athletic games.

Choir

Singing in a choir not only helps students learn about music, but has several other benefits as well, such as improved reading ability, a greater sense of belonging, and discipline. Students will learn voice the basics of reading music and will participate in recitals throughout the year.

Drama

Drama can enhance students’ creativity, confidence, and focus. It stimulates the imagination and inspires collaboration. The Drama team will perform two shows during the year.

Computer science club

The computer science club is intended to help expand students’ understanding of technology and basic programming. One of the highlights will be a collaborative project to develop a gaming app.

Craft club

Students will learn to express themselves in their own unique ways through arts and crafts. Through the art of crafting, students will utilize their creativity and learn new skills. Focus groups will include wood carving, knit and crochet, collage art, and jewelry making. At the end of the season, student art will be displayed along with an art walk.

Aerospace club

Students will learn about space flight, the International Space Station, and learn basic engineering skills as they build rocket models, including a collaborative effort to design and build a flight-capable model. A highlight activity will be a group launch of a model rocket built by the students.

Athletics program: New director appointed

We’re proud to announce that Mr. Arden Asher has been appointed as the new director for our athletics program. He is succeeding George Potter, who is retiring after this year. Arden Asher was previously assistant director for activities and athletics, and taught health science classes. We are glad he will continue with us in this expanded role.

As athletic director, Arden Asher will supervise coaching staff, facilities, scheduling of games and tournaments, and oversee the athletic program budget. He will also ensure that policies are adhered to by all athletic programs. 

Arden Asher has a master’s degree in Sports administration, as well as a bachelor’s degree in Physical Education and Health.​​​​​​​

Here's a message from Mr. Asher:

“I’m proud and excited to take on the additional responsibilities and direction of our Athletics the department. I am looking forward to working with many of you this coming year. Together, we will carry on the proud legacy of Pineview excellence in sports. Let's go team!"

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
A welcome note from the Principal
​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
Welcome back, Pineview! I hope you had a wonderful summer. This school year is already shaping up to be very eventful.

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value:
TRUE TO OUR MISSION 

At Pineview, we are committed to conserving the environment

Environmental sustainability is one of the most critical issues of our time. Pineview's commitment to the environment is integrated into every facet of our day-to-day including course work, student opportunities and administration. Here are some ways you can actively contribute:

pnp:ClientSidePage.Title: Alumni give back to Pineview's art program

pnp:CanvasControlProperty.Value: Over this summer, rising Juniors and Seniors of Pineview's art program organized a showcase evening for alumni. The evening included a panel discussion with alumni of the program who were currently pursuing or had completed art-related majors in college.
